column4: hello, im running Ubuntu 11.10 on a compaq cq60 and every now and then my screen will flicker how do i fix this please ?
so to the best of your knowledge, you are running  a stock ubuntu 11.10 without any custimaztions?
ok, and how often does flicker did you say?
:- it flickers for about 3 mins then stops again
ok, first, do you know how to use pastebin?
ok, first please post the results of lspci -v as well as modprobe -l
and now please dmesg | grep NVIDIA
oh, then you'll need to issue this instead.  gunzip -c /var/log/dmesg.1.gz | grep NVIDIA
or instead of dmesg.1.gz, use dmesg.0.gz
i pasted the log to :- http://paste.ubuntu.com/774213/
nope, I want a dmesg output that has NVIDIA in it otherwise you're not using the correct module for your installed graphics card
anytime. my colledted knoweldge using ubuntu over 5 yeasr has made me be able to "pay it forward" to others who are joing the revolution. LOL
i would say when you get the correct graphics module (which BTW is nvidia-current) you'll be golden and loving ubuntu again
